headline: weather advisory in effect
description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Additional snowfall amounts up to 4 cm.
Reduced visibility in areas of heavier snow and blowing snow.

When:
Now into early Thursday morning.

Additional information:
Areas north of Lake Superior are on the western edge of a winter storm.  Northeasterly winds gusting to 50 km/h will result in areas of blowing snow giving reduced visibility.

Note that winter storm warnings are in effect for regions to the east where significantly higher snowfall amounts are expected.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly. Poor weather conditions may contribute to transportation delays.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve.
